data: Contrast Allergy Pre-Medication Orders - Adult (Urgent and Emergent) (Module)

Indications for Prophylactic Therapy:  Patients with a previous history of a mild to moderate contrast allergy and considered high-risk for subsequent allergy to intravascular contrast media requiring an urgent or emergent contrast-enhanced imaging study with LESS THAN 12 hours' notice    -A prior history of a severe contrast reaction is considered a relative contraindication to receiving the same class of contrast media in the future    -Primary consideration should be given to administering a different low or iso-osmolar iodinated contrast agent from the culprit contrst agent that caused the previous adverse event    -Consultation between clinical teams may be required to evaluate the risk-benefit ratio when there is a history of a prior contrast reaction    -Steroid therapy is considered safe in the pregnant patient and the following pre-medication regimen to reduce the risk of contrast media reaction should not be withheld
Initiate saline lock with 20G IV in the Ante Cubital Focca (Right ACF preferred). Notify provider if not possible
Patient preferred to be NPO minimum of 4 hours prior to scheduled exam
40 mg, IV direct, as directed, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
50 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
Emergent 1 Hour Protocol (Call Medical Imaging immediately to discuss emergent options)
40 mg, IV direct, as directed, drug form: inj
50 mg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
